availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John W. Price (Green County, Kentucky, laborer and soldier.)

body.p: Green County, Kentucky, laborer and soldier. Green County, Kentucky, native. Son of Graves Price. Married to Mary Wagener Price in Hart County, Kentucky, on January 20, 1861. Father of Lida J. Price and George W. Price. Resident of Green County in 1850. Laborer in Green County in 1860. Household owned nine enslaved persons in Green County in 1860. Served in the 13th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a private from December 31, 1861, to November 22, 1862. Discharged on account of disability on November 22, 1862.

ab.bibl:

Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll 994036, Green County Births.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll 994036, Green County Deaths.
"Price, John W.," Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers Who Served in Organizations From the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0267.
